term.title: black film

item.text: A film thinner than about 1/4wavelength of visible light. Black films are often equilibrium films, but equilibrium films may be considerably thicker under some conditions. In soap films, two types of equilibrium film are often observed: the one characterized by thickness of the order of 7 nm or more which varies significantly with minor changes in composition such as ionic strength is called common black film.
